reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: SEA TURTLE CONSERVATION IN MAINLAND EQUATORIAL GUINEA

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes The recipient will conduct patrols to protect nests and nesting females at Punta Illend Naural Reserve (5km), Rio Campo Natural Reserve (7 km) and Nendyi Scientific Reserve (4 km); conduct a training seminar for 15 participants on sea turtle biology and Identification, data collection, field technology/equipment use, wildlife laws, enforcement procedures, and sea turtle conservation; conduct outreach an education campaigns with local schools, fisherman, urban locations, national authorities; and collect data on mainland coastline to assess levels of harvesting and bycatch of marine turtles..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: U.S. assistance to Equatorial Guinea focuses on introducing the country’s military and police forces to the principles of human rights, good governance and democracy, and on improving regional maritime security. (Source: Congressional Budget Justification FY 2011)
